tit.cmt: 織田信弌 is not Nobushige ODA, but Nobukazu ODA.http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%B9%94%E7%94%B0%E4%BF%A1%E5%BC%8C

sen.j: 織田信弌（おだ のぶかず ？ - 天正10年6月2日 (旧暦)（1582年6月21日））は戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Nobukazu ODA (? - June 21, 1582) is a Japanese military commander in the Sengoku period (the period of warring states).
Nobukazu ODA (? - June 21, 1582) was a Japanese military commander in the Sengoku period (the period of warring states).
Nobukazu ODA (? - June 21, 1582) was a Japanese military commander who lived during the Sengoku period (the period of warring states).

sen.j: 父は尾張国の豪族大橋重長。
sen.e: His father was Shigenaga OHASHI, a local ruling family in Owari province.
His father was Shigenaga OHASHI, a local ruling family in Owari province.
His father was Shigenaga OHASHI, a local ruling family in Owari province.

sen.j: 母は織田信秀の娘、くらの方。
sen.e: His mother was Kura no kata, a daughter of Nobuhide ODA.
His mother was Kura no kata, a daughter of Nobuhide ODA.
His mother was Kura no kata, a daughter of Nobuhide ODA.

sen.j: 天正九年（1581年）の馬揃連枝衆に名が見える。
sen.e: Nobukazu was one of the noble siblings at the Kyoto great military parade held in 1581.
sen.cmt: 京都御馬揃え (Kyoto great military parade)http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BA%AC%E9%83%BD%E5%BE%A1%E9%A6%AC%E6%8F%83%E3%81%88
sen.e: Nobukazu was one of the noble siblings at the Kyoto great military parade held in 1581.
Nobukazu was one of the noble siblings at the Kyoto great military parade held in 1581.

sen.j: 天正十年（1582年）6月2日、本能寺の変にて没する。
sen.e: Nobukazu died at the Honnoji Incident in June 2, 1582.
Nobukazu died at the Honnoji Incident in June 2, 1582.
Nobukazu died at the Honnoji Incident in June 2, 1582.
